summary: This appears to be a fragment of internal communication or notes from August 2019, referencing media inquiries by journalist Jonathan Dienst about Jeffrey Epstein's suicide watch status following his arrest. The message instructs the recipient to stick to a script and not comment.

persons.name: Jonathan Dienst
persons.context: A journalist who was trying to confirm if Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch in August 2019, prompting the internal communication about sticking to a script.

persons.name: Epstien
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein, the central figure in the case, is referenced in the context of media inquiries about his suicide watch status following his arrest.

events.title: Media Inquiry About Epstein's Suicide Watch
events.description: Journalist Jonathan Dienst attempts to confirm if Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch.

events.title: Internal Communication About Media Strategy
events.description: An internal message is sent, reminding the recipient to stick to a script and not comment on inquiries about Epstein's suicide watch.

keyFacts: In August 2019, journalist Jonathan Dienst was actively trying to confirm if Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch.
Internal communication instructed someone to 'stick to the script' and respond with 'Can't comment on that' regarding these inquiries.
The document fragment suggests a coordinated media or legal strategy to manage information about Epstein's status following his arrest.
